view

Class TTTPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • view.TTTPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class TTTPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class represents one square in a Tic-Tac-Toe game board. It extends JPanel, and also is accessible as a Location object when referred to in the "model" section.
    Author:
    Theo Davis and Sacha Best
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int col
      The row and column for creation of a Location object corresponding to each individual TTTPanel in the TTTFrame.

      The current Image displayed on the TTTPanel.
      private Location gridLocation
      The Location corresponding to each TTTPanel in reference to the rest of the panels in the TTTFrame.
      private int player
      An int representing which image of the skin should be displayed on this TTTPanel, based on whose turn it is.

      The row and column for creation of a Location object corresponding to each individual TTTPanel in the TTTFrame.
      private Skin skin
      The Skin to be used on this TTTPanel.

    • Field Detail

      • row

        private int row
        The row and column for creation of a Location object corresponding to each individual TTTPanel in the TTTFrame.

      • col

        private int col
        The row and column for creation of a Location object corresponding to each individual TTTPanel in the TTTFrame.

      • gridLocation

        private Location gridLocation
        The Location corresponding to each TTTPanel in reference to the rest of the panels in the TTTFrame. Created based upon row and col.

      • skin

        private Skin skin
        The Skin to be used on this TTTPanel.

      • currentImage

        private java.awt.Image currentImage
        The current Image displayed on the TTTPanel.

      • player

        private int player
        An int representing which image of the skin should be displayed on this TTTPanel, based on whose turn it is.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TTTPanel

        public TTTPanel(int row,
        int col,
        Skin skin)
        Creates a new TTTPanel with the given row and column. Sets it visible on the screen, and sets the initial size to 500 x 500 pixels. The panel will resize as the window it resides in resizes. This constructor also attaches an appropriate Location object to each TTTPanel created. In addition, the player variable is initialized to -1 before being marked. Finally, the Skin is set, and the color of the border surrounding the panel is adapted to fit the Skin's color.
        Parameters:
        row - - the row
        col - - the column
        skin - - the Skin to be used.

    • Method Detail

      • getGridLocation

        public Location getGridLocation()
        Returns:
        the relative Location in the grid of TTTPanels in TTTFrame.

      • changeSkin

        public void changeSkin(Skin changeTo)
        This method changes the Skin of the TTTPanel and repaints it as necessary.
        Parameters:
        changeTo - - the new Skin to be used.

      • mark

        public void mark(int player)
        This method marks a player's move on this TTTPanel, changing the Image it displays from the background color to the image representing the player that moved.
        Parameters:
        player - - the player that moved.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method overrides the superclass method to paint the currentImage instance variable on the TTTPanel.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
